Logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Logic.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The logic class of the program that operates both the moves and the move evaluations

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(int size, int gameMode)
      Creates the game board and initiates the first move

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean checkForVictoryOrLoss(int[][] board)
      Checks if the given board state means that one of the players has already won
      static int evaluateMove(int[][] board, int whosTurn, int turnCount)
      Evaluates the minmax value of a potential move in the current board state
      static void makeMove(int[][] board, int whosTurn, int gameMode)
      Makes a move on the game board (either given by the user or evaluated as the best possible move by the algorithm)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int size,
    int gameMode)
        Creates the game board and initiates the first move
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the game board as given by the user (3x3, 5x5 or 7x7)
        gameMode - the chosen game mode (1 = human vs ai, 2 = ai vs human, 3 = ai vs ai, 4 = human vs human)

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public static void makeMove(int[][] board,
            int whosTurn,
            int gameMode)
        Makes a move on the game board (either given by the user or evaluated as the best possible move by the algorithm)
        Parameters:
        board - the current game board
        whosTurn - which player's turn it is currently (1 or 2)
        gameMode - the chosen game mode (1 = human vs ai, 2 = ai vs human, 3 = ai vs ai, 4 = human vs human)

      • evaluateMove

        public static int evaluateMove(int[][] board,
               int whosTurn,
               int turnCount)
        Evaluates the minmax value of a potential move in the current board state
        Parameters:
        board - the current game board
        whosTurn - the player whose next possible moves are being evaluated (1 or 2)
        turnCount - how many turns ahead of the current board state the evaluation currently is
        Returns:
        minMaxSum the minmax value of this potential move in the current board state

      • checkForVictoryOrLoss

        public static boolean checkForVictoryOrLoss(int[][] board)
        Checks if the given board state means that one of the players has already won
        Parameters:
        board - the temporary game board to be checked
        Returns:
        true if one of the players has already won, otherwise false
